alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Lamoille; Washington; Western Addison; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 7:01PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lamoille, north central Addison, southeastern Chittenden and northwestern Washington Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 700 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over St. George, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Burlington, Underhill, Jericho, Hinesburg, St. George, Huntington, Monkton Ridge, Duxbury, Waterbury Village, Waterbury, Underhill State Park, Williston, Bolton, Richmond, Moretown, Jericho Village, Shelburne, Charlotte, Monkton, and Starksboro. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 61 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Lamoille; Washington; Western Addison; Western Chittenden
